text: When removing contacts from a list why does it take so long to take effect. I generally have more than 100 contacts in the list and you can only remove 100 contacts at a time. But when i refresh the number of contacts in the list is still the same, any ideas?
I have successfully connected to a HubSpot test account with a new HubSpot app
but test accounts are mostly empty
I have found that HubSpot has an app to create demo accounts - <https://generator.demospot.org/switch>
but seems to be only available to solution partners
is any similar resource available for people working on integrating with HubSpot? we also need 'demo' accounts to test the integrations

I am currently working on a client's website, which includes a meeting scheduling form. Unfortunately, this form exhibits a vertical overflow issue, causing an unpleasant user experience due to excessive scrolling vertical overflow . To address this problem, I am seeking advice on how to eliminate the vertical overflow and optimize the form's layout as I have tried to overwrite its styling but doesn,t take any styling in CSS .  Here is an  actual form <https://homedev.agileit.com/schedule-a-call>. It got some steps for confirmation and leads to the layout.

:sparkles:Slack Tips and Best Practices:sparkles:

To get the most out the HubSpot Developer Slack, follow these best practices:

• Will your post/question potentially help more than one person? Ask in a public channel instead of 1:1 DMs to help as many folks as possible. 
• Thread all replies to keep topics organized and searchable
• Thread followup questions/comments to your original post
• Don't post the same question in multiple channels. If you must, link to your original question in new channels.
More <https://slack.com/blog/collaboration/etiquette-tips-in-slack|great tips here>. Thanks for making the HubSpot Developer Slack easier to use for everyone!
Thanks Evelynn. Good insight, that’s one of my main candidates for causing trouble. Still sorting out if it’s the embeds themselves, the consent banner, or some interaction with the a/b testing.
